revision.comment: Disambiguating links to [[Roman]] (link changed to [[Ancient Rome]]) using [[User:Qwertyytrewqqwerty/DisamAssist|DisamAssist]].

|blank_name = |blank_info = |blank1_name = |blank1_info = |website = [http://www.commune-sbiba.gov.tn/AR/Sbiba_ar.html Sbiba Official Website] |footnotes = }} '''Sbiba''' ({{lang-ar|سبيبة}}) is a city surrounded by chains of mountains in the province of [[Kasserine Governorate|Kasserine]].
==Background== '''Sbiba''' is a city in the Midwest of Tunisia on the latitude of 35° and 36°, about 70 km far from [[Kasserine]], bounded on the north with [[Jedelienne]], [[Sbeitla]] to the South. Sbiba was first founded by the [[Ancient Rome|Romans]].
==Geography== The city is located at the site of the ancient city of [[Sufes]] at the altitude of 630m. By the city is located the Mount Jbel Mghuila which is the highest peak in the region with 1370m.
==Economy== The city is famous for its apples, tomatoes and fresh water. Sbiba produces nearly 40% of the Tunisian total production of apples and tomatoes due to its very advanced system of irrigation. Despite its population of around 55,000, Sbiba suffers from a lack of national and international investments in the fields of industry, agriculture and especially services.
